column4: for some reason my Broadcom 802.11g Network Adapter was working great, and now it suddenly wont allow me to network wirlesly, only wired, any ideas? I believe it is tied to an auto update
Check your drives on shell with lsmod, check ps -ax for a wireless daemon.. check apt for wireless package..
open up a terminal, ssh root@localhost passwd, or use sudo, su to perform root command. or hit ctrl-alt-f1 that give you a login shell, and then put in root/pw

if you don't even know how to get to a shell, I can't help you. You may be able to use the administrator tab to fix it, you may also want to look at your synaptics for a wireless package and reinstall it.
